text: Daniel Licht, was a talented composer, who unfortunately was not very recognized for being in video games and series very Undervalued by the community, but his songs was very good, a pity to hear that this great composer died on August 4, 2017 because Of the cancer, many may not care about this but since I listen to several of his songs I became his fan, a pity that the community of Silent Hill has been very forgotten to be in the silent hill considered the black sheep of the saga and never Was up to the legend Akira Yamaoka, but did a very good job I have to admit

author: TheTechPoTaToCHIP

text:
True fans will like every main Silent Hill game... why ? Because they all had this fresh experience to offer... 

There really hasn't been a bad SH game really... (Book of memories doesn't exist!)

In fact, I was just playing through Homecoming too, and man, I can't explain enough how important it was to the expansion of the Silent Hill lore. The game was so good, with great combat and a really sad and heartbreaking story! Alex is a nicely written character!

One thing people can’t stop complaining about is how it featured Pyramid Head. I would like to ask “these” fans if they have ever taken their time to actually follow the original director’s vision on it. Basically, Pyramid head isn’t only unique to James from Silent Hill 2, but is instead the universal symbol for punishment in Silent Hill. You had even seen dark world paintings of it in Silent Hill origins, so how could it be unique to only one game?

Anyways, the story was really beautiful in this game, and it had a really good cover art as well. Also, the history of Shepherd’s Glenn was really interconnected with the Silent Hill history, and had details filled in every corner. This was not a bad Silent Hill game, Book of Memories is a bad Silent Hill game… this was a great Silent Hill
author: Harris iqbal

text: @Harris iqbal People bitching about Pyramid Head drives me nuts. Spoilers abound, but if Pyramid Head is meant to serve as James' guilt for killing his wife, then why shouldn't he serve as Alex's guilt for killing his brother? They both killed someone they love, and they both feel so remorseful about it they repress the actual memory of doing it. Whether or not Pyramid Head's inclusion was mega fan service, he still fits in the lore of Homecoming's story.
author: Odiekun

text: @Odiekun I agree... They just like to feel superior because they've apparently played the classic games.
author: Harris iqbal

text: Oh yeah I've played all of them (except the embarrassing Vita game). It's my favorite horror series out there bar none. I love Homecoming, I hate 2, and I'm completely unapologetic about it.
author: Odiekun

text: Exactly, it is different for different people.
author: Harris iqbal

text: True silent hill fans shouldn't bitch about how nothing compares to 2 and all the original 4 are the best. Be open to change you know? That being said I did dislike homecoming and shattered memories, but I loved the story and the atmosphere in Downpour. I do think it would be nice to see the next game have a solid footing in every aspect like the originals BUT I'm not saying it necessarily has to go back to exactly how the first 4 were.

text: I'm sad Yamaoka isn't working on Silent Hill anymore, but I have to give credit for finding a nice replacement in Daniel Licht (notably responsible for the soundtrack in Dexter).
